Enchant creature

We all must profit for peace to last.

—Mercadian saying

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Arms Dealer to activate its own ability.

cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be played.
cards.flavor: Orim had no memory of the previous night—the first thing she could remember was waking up with the dead guard's blood on her hands.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I see more than others do because I know where to look."

—Saprazzan vizier

rulings.text: This is all one effect. You draw 3 and return 2 cards all in one resolution. Nothing may happen between the two. If something triggers on drawing cards, it will go on the stack after Brainstorm finishes resolving.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."

cards.originalText: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Cloud Sprite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Cloud Sprite may block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

cards.name: Coastal Piracy
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."

rulings.text: You draw one card per creature, not one per point of damage.

cards.name: Collective Unconscious
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.

cards.name: Common Cause
cards.text: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.
cards.originalText: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.
cards.flavor: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.

rulings.text: It really does mean "all creatures", including your opponent's.

The ability gives +2/+2 to all creatures which are not artifact creatures, as long as every one of those creatures is of the same color. They can have additional colors beyond the one they share, but they all have to share one color. If any creature is not of the shared color, the bonus is lost.

cards.name: Conspiracy
cards.text:
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.

Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.
cards.originalText:
As Conspiracy comes into play, choose a creature type.

Creatures you control and creature cards in your graveyard, hand, and library are of the chosen type.

rulings.text: It does not replace any use of creature types in card text.
This can grant a creature type to animated lands and artifacts that would otherwise have no creature type.
"Legend" is no longer a creature type, and may not be chosen.
If you choose Wall, then your creatures can still attack because creature types don't confer abilities such as defender (any more than, say, choosing creature type Bird would confer flying).
Affected spells, cards, and creatures lose all of their other creature types.

cards.name: Cornered Market
cards.text:
Players can't cast spells with the same name as a nontoken permanent.

Players can't play nonbasic lands with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
cards.originalText: Players can't play spells or nonbasic lands with the same name as a card in play.
cards.flavor:
Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.

—Mercadian saying

rulings.text: Cornered Market does not prevent effects which put a card onto the battlefield. It only stops people from casting.
This card only looks at permanents, not spells on the stack. So it is possible to cast two instances of a spell onto the stack.

cards.originalText:

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.

cards.name: Crooked Scales
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy target creature you control unless you pay {3} and repeat this process.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature the opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature you control unless you pay {3} and reflip the coin.

rulings.text: If you pay the {3}, you do not choose a new pair of targets when it repeats. This means that if you lose the flip, you have the choice of having your creature destroyed or paying {3} to try again to win the flip. If you lose again, you get the same choice, and so on. You can keep trying to destroy your opponent's creature as long as you have mana to pay.
You choose both targets on activation, so you can only activate this when you can legally choose both targets.

cards.name: Crossbow Infantry
cards.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.originalText: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: The crossbow is the ideal weapon for the lazy Mercadians: just point and shoot.

cards.name: Crumbling Sanctuary
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to a player, that player exiles that many cards from the top of his or her library instead.
cards.originalText: For each 1 damage that would be dealt to a player, that player removes the top card of his or her library from the game instead.

rulings.text: If you have no cards in your library, then damage done to you will have no effect since it will get changed into a removal that can't happen.
The ability affects all players.

cards.name: Customs Depot
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.
cards.flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Eye of twilight, give us sight.

Take our offer, give us might.

Make our power tears of night."
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Darting Merfolk
cards.text: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: {U} Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: You might as well try to catch water with a net.

cards.name: Dawnstrider
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor: Morning's mists can hide many things.

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText: Deadly Insect can't be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.

cards.name: Deathgazer
cards.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Deepwood Drummer
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

cards.name: Deepwood Elder
cards.text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: X target lands become forests until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

cards.name: Deepwood Ghoul
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
cards.originalText: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
cards.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.

cards.name: Deepwood Legate
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a forest and you control a swamp, you may play Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

{B} Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Deepwood Tantiv
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

cards.name: Deepwood Wolverine
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat." 

—Sisay

cards.name: Delraich
cards.text:
Trample

You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay Delraich's mana cost.
cards.originalText:
Trample

You may sacrifice three black creatures instead of paying Delraich's mana cost.
cards.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.
cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent.
cards.flavor: The magical dust clouds Mercadian mages use to traverse the plane generate storms that devastate the surrounding terrain. But as long as the storms don't touch the mountain, the nobles simply don't care.

cards.name: Devout Witness
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.

cards.name: Diplomatic Escort
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
The scepter of power is fragile in a calloused hand.

—Cho-Arrim saying

cards.name: Distorting Lens
cards.text: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The magistrate seems to prefer a distorted perspective of reality.

Flying

cards.originalText: All artifacts gain "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
cards.flavor: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.

cards.originalText: When Enslaved Horror comes into play, each other player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.originalText: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.

cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.
cards.flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.

cards.originalText:
Flying

cards.flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.

cards.flavor: "Go down there and fish him out. Maybe his hide will fetch a price."

Enchant creature

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.

"You lot go on ahead. I'll keep killing them until it sticks."

—Tahngarth

This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.

cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.text: Artifacts and enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText: Artifacts and enchantments you control can't be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.

cards.name: Fresh Volunteers
cards.flavor: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.

cards.name: Furious Assault
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player.
cards.flavor:
"Does it burn, Saprazzan? Do you wish you had never raised arms against us?"

—Kyren overseer

rulings.text: You can choose a different target player each time this triggers.

cards.name: Game Preserve
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards onto the battlefield under their owners' control.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards into play under their owners' control. (Otherwise, put them back face-down on top of their owners' libraries.)

cards.name: General's Regalia
cards.text: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.originalText: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.flavor: A uniform fit for a goblin.

cards.name: Gerrard's Irregulars
cards.text: Trample, haste
cards.originalText: Trample; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Had Gerrard realized he'd end up fighting against them, he might not have trained them so well.

cards.name: Ghoul's Feast
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."

cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Butterfly creature token with flying into play at end of turn.

rulings.text: It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

cards.originalText: When Glowing Anemone comes into play, you may return target land to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText: {1}{G} Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.originalText: {B} Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.originalText: You can't be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: "I did not choose my role, Orim," said Cho-Manno patiently, "and I suspect Gerrard did not choose his."

cards.name: Jeweled Torque
cards.text:
As Jeweled Torque enters the battlefield, choose a color.

Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
As Jeweled Torque comes into play, choose a color.

Whenever a player plays a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Jhovall Queen
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Jhovall Queen to tap.
cards.flavor: War-trained jhovalls eat twice their weight in war-trained soldiers daily.

cards.name: Jhovall Rider
cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.

cards.name: Karn's Touch
cards.text: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)
cards.originalText: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Kris Mage
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.

cards.name: Kyren Archive
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile the top card of your library face down.

{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards exiled with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove the top card of your library from the game face down.

{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards removed from the game with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.

cards.name: Kyren Glider
cards.text:
Flying

Kyren Glider can't block.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Kyren Glider can't block.
cards.flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.

cards.name: Kyren Legate
cards.text:
Haste

If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Mountain, you may cast Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a plains and you control a mountain, you may play Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.

Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Kyren Negotiations
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.

cards.name: Kyren Sniper
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.

cards.name: Kyren Toy
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.

{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add {X}{1} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.

{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add X plus one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Land Grant
cards.text:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand rather than pay Land Grant's mana cost.

Search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand instead of paying Land Grant's mana cost.

Search your library for a forest card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can pay the "reveal your hand" cost even if your hand is already revealed due to another effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Larceny
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

rulings.text: Triggers once per creature, not once per point of damage.

cards.name: Last Breath
cards.text: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.
cards.originalText: Remove target creature with power 2 or less from the game. Its controller gains 4 life.
cards.flavor: "The River flows. My soul returns."

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Last Breath tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. Its controller won’t gain 4 life.

cards.name: Lava Runner
cards.text:
Haste

Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Ley Line
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of his or her choice.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."

—Gerrard

cards.name: Liability
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a card is put into a player's graveyard from play, that player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.

cards.name: Lightning Hounds
cards.text: First strike
cards.originalText: First strike
cards.flavor: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.

cards.name: Lithophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a Mountain.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a mountain.
cards.flavor: It's viciously territorial, destroying every creature on the mountain it has chosen to consume.

cards.name: Lumbering Satyr
cards.text: All creatures have forestwalk.
cards.originalText: All creatures gain forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)
cards.flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.

—Cho-Arrim saying

cards.name: Lunge
cards.text: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
cards.originalText: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature

All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so if able.
cards.flavor: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.

rulings.text: Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

cards.name: Maggot Therapy
cards.text:
Flash

Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
cards.originalText:
You may play Maggot Therapy any time you could play an instant.

Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
cards.flavor:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."

—Orim

cards.name: Magistrate's Scepter
cards.text:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.

{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take an extra turn after this one.
cards.originalText:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.

{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take another turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.name: Magistrate's Veto
cards.text: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.
cards.originalText: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: The magistrate had been the goblins' puppet for so long that he made the right decisions with little prompting.

cards.name: Megatherium
cards.text:
Trample

When Megatherium enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.originalText:
Trample

When Megatherium comes into play, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Mercadia's Downfall
cards.text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of nonbasic lands defending player controls.
cards.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.

rulings.text: The creatures that are attacking is determined when this resolves and is not changed later, even if you have another combat phase.

cards.name: Mercadian Atlas
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: At the end of your turn, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.

rulings.text: It only checks if you played a land. Putting a land onto the battlefield by using an effect of another card does not count as "playing a land".

cards.name: Mercadian Bazaar
cards.text:
Mercadian Bazaar enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.

{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.
cards.originalText:
Mercadian Bazaar comes into play tapped.

{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.

{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add one red mana to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Mercadian Lift
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.

{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.

{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: Put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand into play.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.name: Midnight Ritual
cards.text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Remove X target creature cards in your graveyard from the game. For each creature card removed this way, put a black 2/2 Zombie creature token into play.
cards.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Misdirection's mana cost.

Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a blue card in your hand from the game instead of paying Misdirection's mana cost.

Target spell with a single target targets another target instead.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.

cards.name: Misshapen Fiend
cards.text: Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

cards.name: Misstep
cards.text: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.
cards.originalText: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
The feet have no eyes.

—Saprazzan saying

rulings.text: The creatures are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creature controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes creatures which entered the battlefield after Misstep resolved.

cards.name: Molting Harpy
cards.text:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.
cards.originalText:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.
cards.flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.

cards.name: Moment of Silence
cards.text: Target player skips his or her next combat phase this turn.
cards.originalText: Target player skips his or her combat phase this turn.
cards.flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.

rulings.text: The player skips their next combat phase this turn (if any). If they manage to have two combat phases, then only their next one combat phase is skipped.
It must be used before the combat phase starts or it has no effect.
If cast on a player when it is not their turn, it has no effect.

cards.name: Monkey Cage
cards.text: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put X 2/2 green Ape creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: When a creature comes into play, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put into play a number of 2/2 green Ape creature tokens equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Moonlit Wake
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."

—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

Enchant creature

Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.

—Cho-Arrim saying

cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.originalText: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They still count as lands.
cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Nether Spirit
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to play.
cards.flavor: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.

cards.name: Nightwind Glider
cards.text: Flying, protection from black
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from black
cards.flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.

cards.name: Noble Purpose
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

cards.name: Notorious Assassin
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.originalText: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.

cards.name: Orim's Cure
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Orim's Cure's mana cost.

Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText:
If you control a plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control instead of paying the mana cost of Orim's Cure.

Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Overtaker
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."

cards.name: Panacea
cards.text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.

cards.name: Pangosaur
cards.text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

cards.name: Peat Bog
cards.text:
Peat Bog enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.

{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Peat Bog: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Peat Bog, sacrifice it.
cards.originalText:
Peat Bog comes into play tapped with two depletion counters on it.

{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Peat Bog: Add two black mana to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Peat Bog, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Pious Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.originalText: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.

cards.name: Port Inspector
cards.text: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.
cards.originalText: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.
cards.flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."

cards.name: Power Matrix
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.

cards.name: Pretender's Claim
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.
cards.flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.

cards.name: Primeval Shambler
cards.text: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {B} Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

cards.name: Puffer Extract
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at end of turn.
cards.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.

cards.name: Pulverize
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Pulverize's mana cost.

Destroy all artifacts.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice two mountains instead of paying Pulverize's mana cost.

Destroy all artifacts.

cards.name: Puppet's Verdict
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.originalText: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"What was heads again?"

—Mercadian magistrate

cards.name: Putrefaction
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell or green spell, that player discards a card from his or her hand.
cards.flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"

—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

cards.name: Quagmire Lamprey
cards.text: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.

cards.name: Ramosian Captain
cards.text:
First strike

{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Thieves' Auction
cards.text: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.
cards.originalText: Set aside all permanents. You choose one of those cards and put it into play tapped under your control. Then your opponent chooses one and puts it into play tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards set aside this way have been chosen. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain removed from the game.)

rulings.text: In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.

If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.flavor: Sisay had been restored to her place on the ship, the Legacy had been recovered, and the Weatherlight was sailing home to Dominaria. Gerrard focused on the debts he'd settled . . . and on those he'd soon collect.

rulings.text: If the ability is used on a creature with Trample, the damage still comes through.
This ability will trigger any creature's "whenever this becomes blocked" ability.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can be activated during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Vendetta  resolves, the spell is countered. You won't lose life.
The destroyed creature's last existence on the battlefield is checked  to determine its toughness.

If the targeted creature isn't destroyed due to totem armor's effect,  Vendetta continues to resolve. You lose life equal to the creature's  current toughness (after the Aura with totem armor has been destroyed).

cards.originalText: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures in play.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."

rulings.text: The value of X is determined at the time you announce this spell, and you choose the targets and the division of damage among those targets as part of the announcement as well.
If there are no creatures on the battlefield when you cast this, you do not pick any targets and it deals no damage.
If there is at least one creature on the battlefield when you are announcing this, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets.

cards.name: War Cadence
cards.text: {X}{R}: This turn, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature he or she controls.
cards.originalText: {X}{R} Creatures can't block this turn unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature.
cards.flavor: The rhythm isn't a call to arms, but a signal that the goblins have made a new enemy.

rulings.text: You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't block unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid). You can use this to make your creatures unable to block an attacker.
The ability only applies to blocks declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any blockers already announced.

cards.name: War Tax
cards.text: {X}{U}: This turn, creatures can't attack unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature he or she controls.
cards.originalText: {X}{U} Creatures can't attack this turn unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.

rulings.text: You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't attack unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid, so the controller can choose to not pay).
The ability only applies to attackers declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any attackers already announced.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
